intro: Cymodocea preauxiana, commonly known as the dwarf seagrass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Posidoniaceae. It is characterized by its short, tufted blades and is typically found in shallow coastal waters. This species plays a vital role in stabilizing sediment and providing habitat for various marine organisms. It is native to the Indo-Pacific region, including parts of the Red Sea and the Indian Ocean. Due to its ecological importance, it is often studied for its role in coastal ecosystems.
